definition[0]: someone who is practised in a particular job or skill is good at it because they have done it many times before
note[0]: to the practised eye (=to someone who has seen something many times and knows a lot about it)
example[1]: He was already well practiced in giving acceptance speeches.
definition[1]: a practised action has been done so often that it now seems very easy
example[2]: He faced the television cameras with practised ease.
